definitions: AI is the science of making machines perform tasks that require human intelligence, such as understanding language or recognizing images.
Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to computer systems that can learn, reason, and solve problems like humans.
AI is technology that enables computers to analyze data, make decisions, and improve over time without explicit programming.
AI means building software that can adapt to new information and perform complex tasks automatically.
AI is the field focused on creating algorithms that mimic cognitive functions such as learning and perception.
AI is the use of computers to simulate intelligent behavior, including planning, language, and vision.
AI systems can process large amounts of data to find patterns and make predictions.
AI is about teaching machines to understand, interpret, and interact with the world.
AI enables automation of tasks that previously required human expertise.
AI is the development of smart agents that can act autonomously in dynamic environments.
examples: ChatGPT answering questions in natural language.
Image tagging on social media platforms.
Code completion tools like GitHub Copilot.
Recommendation systems on Netflix or YouTube.
Smart home devices adjusting temperature or lighting.
visual_ideas: Flowchart showing user input -> AI processing -> output.
